text: now India says it has conducted air
raids in pakistan-administered Kashmir
in a major escalation of tension one
government minister says the target had
been terrorist camps a Pakistani
military spokesman says that it's air
force has responded but there have been
no casualties
now both governments are said to be
holding separate emergency meetings the
raids come twelve days now after a
suicide attack in indian-administered
Kashmir which killed 40 Indian troops
well let's speak to our correspondent in
Mumbai Yoga teleme yoga - obviously this
points to further tensions we get that
but conflicting stories as to exactly
what's happened there that's right in
the past hour we've had the Indian
Foreign Secretary come out and give a
statement and he says that these
airstrikes were specifically targeted at
training camps of the militant group
jaish-e-mohammed this is the outfit that
claimed responsibility for the February
14th attack in indian-administered
Kashmir that killed 40 soldiers what the
Indian Foreign Secretary is saying that
it was only the camps of this particular
group that was specifically targeted and
that the selection of the targets was
done in a way that it avoided civilian
casualties and it says that it's been
able to destroy some of these camps and
a very just to quote him a very large
number of fighters from JJ Mohammed they
say have been killed what we know from
the Pakistani military spokesman is that
Indian aircraft did enter Pakistani
airspace but the Pakistan version
differs of course they're saying that
these aircraft had to scramble back
hastily and while they did drop their
payloads though you know that didn't
cause any casualties or any damage is
there much sense that any politicians
really are listening to calls to
de-escalate at this stage rather than
escalate that the sense of tension
between them well at the moment it's
important to you know remember the
context in which all of this is
happening in the next two months we are
going to have an election in India when
you've had such a big attack against
your military 40 soldiers dying it was a
worst attack in indian-administered
Kashmir in 30 years pretty much since
the start of the armed insurgency in
that region the sentiment especially
among the people here has been that you
know the India should seek revenge and
so the government has been under
pressure to act and that's why we're
seeing now military action taking you
know from the Indian side we've seen
sort of Indian aircraft going into
Pakistan control territory earlier two
years ago India claims it conducted
targeted strikes in the territory but
this you know sort of with air strikes
you know at that time it was ground
strikes with air strikes it does seem to
be much larger we've already heard
Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan
saying just a few days ago that if his
country was targeted he would be forced
to retaliate we'll have to see what
comes from those security meetings being
held in both countries at the moment
okay thanks very much indeed bring us
right up-to-date they
